name: Hardcore Hip Hop
description: Confrontation and aggression, whether in the lyricism, vocal delivery, hard beats, heavy production, or any combination thereof.

children.name: Britcore
children.description: British subgenre from the late 1980s and early 1990s featuring fast breakbeats and rapping.

children.name: Chopper
children.description: Originated in the American Midwest in the 1990s; initially defined by slow jam beats rapped over with very fast flows and resonant choruses.

children.name: Horrorcore
children.description: Lyrical and aesthetic focus on the macabre and morbid, with production generally of a darker nature than is typically found in other Hip Hop.

children.name: Memphis Rap
children.description: Minimalistic half-time drum machine programming with droning bass, often paired with aggressive rapping and a double time flow.

children.name: Mid-School Hip Hop
children.description: Based around heavy, stripped-down drum machine beats.

children.name: Trap Metal
children.description: Loud, distorted 808s and basslines, as well as aggressive vocals that are usually yelled or screamed.
